verses.kjv: The word of the LORD came again unto me, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD's message came to me:

verses.kjv: Son of man, say unto the prince of Tyrus, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Because thine heart is lifted up, and thou hast said, I am a God, I sit in the seat of God, in the midst of the seas; yet thou art a man, and not God, though thou set thine heart as the heart of God:
verses.ct: "Son of man, tell the ruler of Tyre: This is what the Lord GOD says — Your heart has become arrogant, and you have declared, 'I am a god! I sit on a divine throne surrounded by the seas.' But you are only a human being, not a god, even though you think of yourself as one."

verses.kjv: Behold, thou art wiser than Daniel; there is no secret that they can hide from thee:
verses.ct: "Look at you — you consider yourself wiser than Daniel! No mystery is hidden from you!"

verses.kjv: With thy wisdom and with thine understanding thou hast gotten thee riches, and hast gotten gold and silver into thy treasures:
verses.ct: "Through your wisdom and cleverness you have amassed wealth, stockpiling gold and silver in your treasuries."

verses.kjv: By thy great wisdom and by thy traffick hast thou increased thy riches, and thine heart is lifted up because of thy riches:
verses.ct: "Through your impressive skill in trade you have multiplied your wealth, and your heart has grown arrogant because of your riches."

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD; Because thou hast set thine heart as the heart of God;
verses.ct: "So this is what the Lord GOD says: Because you have regarded yourself as equal to God,"

verses.kjv: Behold, therefore I will bring strangers upon thee, the terrible of the nations: and they shall draw their swords against the beauty of thy wisdom, and they shall defile thy brightness.
verses.ct: "I am going to bring foreigners against you — the most ruthless of nations. They will draw their swords against your magnificent wisdom and defile your splendor."

verses.kjv: They shall bring thee down to the pit, and thou shalt die the deaths of them that are slain in the midst of the seas.
verses.ct: "They will drag you down to the grave, and you will die a violent death surrounded by the seas."

verses.kjv: Wilt thou yet say before him that slayeth thee, I am God? but thou shalt be a man, and no God, in the hand of him that slayeth thee.
verses.ct: "Will you still claim, 'I am a god,' when you stand before the one who kills you? You will be nothing but a mortal, not a god, in the grip of those who cut you down."

verses.kjv: Thou shalt die the deaths of the uncircumcised by the hand of strangers: for I have spoken it, saith the Lord GOD.
verses.ct: "You will die the death of the godless at the hands of foreigners. I have declared it," says the Lord GOD.

verses.kjv: Moreover the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD's message came to me again:

verses.kjv: Son of man, take up a lamentation upon the king of Tyrus, and say unto him, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Thou sealest up the sum, full of wisdom, and perfect in beauty.
verses.ct: "Son of man, sing a funeral song for the king of Tyre. Tell him: This is what the Lord GOD says — You were the model of perfection, full of wisdom and flawless in beauty."

verses.kjv: Thou hast been in Eden the garden of God; every precious stone was thy covering, the sardius, topaz, and the diamond, the beryl, the onyx, and the jasper, the sapphire, the emerald, and the carbuncle, and gold: the workmanship of thy tabrets and of thy pipes was prepared in thee in the day that thou wast created.
verses.ct: "You were in Eden, the garden of God. Every precious stone adorned you — ruby, topaz, diamond, beryl, onyx, jasper, sapphire, emerald, and carbuncle, all set in gold. Your tambourines and flutes were crafted for you on the day you were created."

verses.kjv: Thou art the anointed cherub that covereth; and I have set thee so: thou wast upon the holy mountain of God; thou hast walked up and down in the midst of the stones of fire.
verses.ct: "You were the anointed guardian cherub, and I placed you there. You were on the holy mountain of God, walking among the fiery stones."

verses.kjv: Thou wast perfect in thy ways from the day that thou wast created, till iniquity was found in thee.
verses.ct: "You were blameless in everything you did from the day you were created until wickedness was discovered in you."

verses.kjv: By the multitude of thy merchandise they have filled the midst of thee with violence, and thou hast sinned: therefore I will cast thee as profane out of the mountain of God: and I will destroy thee, O covering cherub, from the midst of the stones of fire.
verses.ct: "Your widespread trade filled you with violence, and you sinned. So I threw you off the mountain of God as something unholy, and I drove you out, guardian cherub, from among the fiery stones."

verses.kjv: Thine heart was lifted up because of thy beauty, thou hast corrupted thy wisdom by reason of thy brightness: I will cast thee to the ground, I will lay thee before kings, that they may behold thee.
verses.ct: "Your heart became arrogant because of your beauty. You ruined your wisdom on account of your splendor. I will throw you to the ground and put you on display before kings so they can stare at you."

verses.kjv: Thou hast defiled thy sanctuaries by the multitude of thine iniquities, by the iniquity of thy traffick; therefore will I bring forth a fire from the midst of thee, it shall devour thee, and I will bring thee to ashes upon the earth in the sight of all them that behold thee.
verses.ct: "Through your many sins and your dishonest trading, you desecrated your sanctuaries. So I will cause a fire to break out from within you, and it will consume you. I will reduce you to ashes on the ground in front of everyone watching."

verses.kjv: All they that know thee among the people shall be astonished at thee: thou shalt be a terror, and never shalt thou be any more.
verses.ct: "All the nations who knew you will be horrified by what happened to you. You will become an object of terror, and you will be gone forever."

verses.kjv: Again the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD's message came to me:

verses.kjv: Son of man, set thy face against Zidon, and prophesy against it,
verses.ct: "Son of man, turn against Sidon and prophesy against it."

verses.kjv: And say, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, I am against thee, O Zidon; and I will be glorified in the midst of thee: and they shall know that I am the LORD, when I shall have executed judgments in her, and shall be sanctified in her.
verses.ct: "Say: This is what the Lord GOD says — Pay attention, Sidon, I am against you, and I will display my glory within you. People will recognize that I am the LORD when I carry out judgment against her and demonstrate my holiness through her."

verses.kjv: For I will send into her pestilence, and blood into her streets; and the wounded shall be judged in the midst of her by the sword upon her on every side; and they shall know that I am the LORD.
verses.ct: "I will send disease and bloodshed into her streets. Her people will fall to the sword attacking from every direction, and they will recognize that I am the LORD."

verses.kjv: And there shall be no more a pricking brier unto the house of Israel, nor any grieving thorn of all that are round about them, that despised them; and they shall know that I am the Lord GOD.
verses.ct: "Then Israel will no longer have to deal with painful thorns or sharp briers from the surrounding nations that treated them with contempt. And they will recognize that I am the Lord GOD."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the Lord GOD; When I shall have gathered the house of Israel from the people among whom they are scattered, and shall be sanctified in them in the sight of the heathen, then shall they dwell in their land that I have given to my servant Jacob.
verses.ct: "This is what the Lord GOD says: When I gather the people of Israel back from the nations where they have been scattered, I will demonstrate my holiness through them for all the world to see. Then they will live in their own land — the land I gave to my servant Jacob."

verses.kjv: And they shall dwell safely therein, and shall build houses, and plant vineyards; yea, they shall dwell with confidence, when I have executed judgments upon all those that despise them round about them; and they shall know that I am the LORD their God.
verses.ct: "They will live there in safety, building homes and planting vineyards. Yes, they will live securely once I have carried out judgment on all the surrounding nations that treated them with contempt. Then they will recognize that I am the LORD their God."
